title: Bush Sr Executive Power Expansion and Unitary Executive Theory Development (1989-1993)
description: Research Bush Sr administration's systematic expansion of executive power through 'unitary executive' theory development and constitutional interpretation manipulation. Document use of signing statements, expansion of executive privilege claims, and establishment of presidential power precedents that enabled later constitutional crises. Focus on how Bush Sr's legal background and conservative judicial appointments created framework for systematic executive branch empowerment over legislative and judicial branches.
constitutional_issues: constitutional checks and balances systematic weakening
